titleStmt.title: Two ancient patternes of true goodnesse and charity one of Job in the midst of his honovr & wealth, the other of the widow of Sarepta in the extremity of her povertie : both now published together, as fit to be followed in these necessitous times, and both dedicated to the living patterne of true goodnesse and charitie, Gilbert Ld Archbishop of Canterbury, Primate and Metropolitan of all England, &c. / by David Stokes ...
titleStmt.author: Stokes, David, 1591?-1669.

titleStmt.title: Two ancient patternes of true goodnesse and charity one of Job in the midst of his honovr & wealth, the other of the widow of Sarepta in the extremity of her povertie : both now published together, as fit to be followed in these necessitous times, and both dedicated to the living patterne of true goodnesse and charitie, Gilbert Ld Archbishop of Canterbury, Primate and Metropolitan of all England, &c. / by David Stokes ...
titleStmt.author: Stokes, David, 1591?-1669.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by H. Hall ... for Richard Davis,

notesStmt.note: Each sermon has special t.p. and separate paging.
Reproduction of original in the Cambridge University Library.
A sermon upon I Kings 17, 15, of the widow of Sarepta -- A sermon upon Job 29, 15.
